node.title: Looking to travel interstate? Here's what restrictions you can expect in each state or territory
node.alt: Police staff a border checkpoint at Barringun in south-west Queensland, August 2020
node.description: As more jurisdictions ease their domestic border restrictions this week, each state and territory's rules and restrictions are different. Here's a guide to what rules are in place around the country.
node.content:
["This week Queensland and Tasmania will ease their border restrictions, opening up to parts of the country where COVID-19 has been spreading in the community.", "However, while domestic travel is becoming more possible, each state and territory's rules and restrictions differ.\u00a0", "Below is a guide on what restrictions you may currently face as a domestic\u00a0traveller:", "
New South Wales\u00a0
", "There are currently no restrictions on entry to NSW, unless you have been been to these places of high concern in the ACT or Queensland.\u00a0", "If you are a non-resident of NSW and a\u00a0close contact\u00a0in one of these places, you must not enter NSW until 14 days have passed or seven\u00a0days if you are fully vaccinated.", "Should you already be in NSW and a close contact,\u00a0you must self isolate for seven\u00a0days if fully vaccinated, and 14 days if you are not.", "If you are a non-resident and have been\u00a0a\u00a0casual contact\u00a0in one of these places you cannot enter NSW unless you have received a negative COVID-19 PCR test.", "Should you already be in NSW and a casual contact, you must isolate until you receive a negative PCR test.\u00a0", "NSW residents who are a close contact of places of high concern must isolate at home or a suitable location until it has been 14 days since you visited the place of concern. If you are fully vaccinated, you only need to self isolate for seven\u00a0days from the time visited.", "And NSW residents returning home who are casual contacts are required to get tested immediately and isolate until they receive a negative result.", "
Victoria
", "Domestic travellers no longer require a permit to enter Victoria.", "Domestic travellers can enter the state without needing to quarantine, regardless of their vaccination status, as long as they have not been overseas in the previous 14 days.", "
Australian Capital Territory
", "Travellers who have not been in a high-risk geographical area or a close contact exposure location\u00a0in the past 14 days can enter the ACT without restrictions.", "That\u00a0means people from NSW and Victoria must apply for and complete\u00a0an exemption form within 72 hours of their intended arrival in\u00a0the ACT.", "Further restrictions also apply for travellers from close contact locations in Queensland and South Australia.\u00a0", "
Tasmania
", "Until Wednesday, fully vaccinated travellers to Tasmania must register with the e-Travel system and have evidence of a vaccination certificate.\u00a0", "Travellers with medical exemptions, or who are under 12 years and two months of age\u00a0are considered vaccinated.\u00a0", "People from high-risk areas \u2014 which currently include parts of NSW, the ACT and Victoria\u00a0\u2014\u00a0are not able to enter Tasmania unless approved as an Essential Traveller.\u00a0", "From Wednesday,\u00a0Tasmania's borders will open to all fully vaccinated travellers.", "Anyone who is coming to Tasmania from Wednesday, regardless of whether they are a resident or not, needs to\u00a0test negative to COVID-19 in the 72 hours before arrival.", "
South Australia
", "South Australia\u00a0has opened its borders to fully vaccinated travellers. Travellers and returning South Australian\u00a0residents must complete an EntryCheck SA application 14 days prior to arrival in the state.\u00a0", "If you are unvaccinated and do not have an approved exemption, you cannot travel to South Australia.", "Travellers from the ACT, NSW and Victoria are subject to further restrictions, including:\u00a0", "Travellers from Katherine in the Northern Territory are also subject to the restrictions above, as well as:", "
Northern Territory
", "Currently, vaccinated travellers from \"green zones\" with minimal COVID-19 risk can enter the Northern Territory\u00a0without any testing or quarantine requirements.", "Unvaccinated Northern Territory\u00a0residents can travel into the territory\u00a0from a green zone, but they are required to quarantine until they receive a negative test.\u00a0\u00a0", "Double-vaccinated arrivals from \"red zones\" must home quarantine for seven days and be tested.", "Everyone travelling to the Northern Territory\u00a0is required to complete an online Border Entry Form.\u00a0", "From December 20, these rules will change, and there will be no distinctions between hotspots.", "But PCR tests will be required for\u00a0vaccinated travellers and arrivals will be required to stay within Darwin, Katherine and Alice Springs for their first 14 days in the territory.", "
Queensland
", "From 1am AEST on Monday, Queensland's travel rules will change, with people from hotspots (as declared by Queensland authorities) allowed to travel into the state without quarantining as long as they:", "If you don't meet these requirements, you need to arrive by air and will be required to complete 14 days' quarantine.", "Should\u00a0you not be travelling from a hotspot, there are no restrictions on your entry and no quarantine is required.", "
Western Australia
", "Tomorrow, the West\u00a0Australian government is expected to announce when the state will reopen its border to the eastern states and to overseas travellers.", "Until then,\u00a0Western Australia\u00a0restricts travel into the state based on the level of COVID-19 spread in states or territories where you have been\u00a0for 14 days prior to entry.\u00a0\u00a0", "Very low risk", "People travelling from Tasmania \u2014 and Queensland today only \u2014\u00a0can enter Western Australia\u00a0as long as they complete a registration and declaration before travelling and\u00a0complete a health screening at Perth Airport.", "Low risk\u00a0", "People travelling from the Northern Territory\u00a0\u2014\u00a0and Queensland from Monday\u00a0\u2014\u00a0must be fully vaccinated, except\u00a0those aged under 12 years and those who cannot be vaccinated for medical reasons. These travellers then must self-quarantine for 14 days and get a COVID-19 PCR\u00a0test within 48 hours of arrival and on day 12 of their quarantine.", "Medium risk", "People travelling from ACT and South Australia\u00a0cannot enter Western\u00a0Australia without prior approval through a GTG Pass and must show proof of vaccination. Approved travellers must get a PCR test 72 hours prior to departure and are also subject to quarantine and testing restrictions as outlined for low-risk travellers.", "High risk", "Travellers from New South Wales\u00a0also need approval to enter Western Australia\u00a0and are subject to the same restrictions as travellers from medium-risk jurisdictions but they also must get a PCR test if symptoms develop during their\u00a0quarantine. The\u00a0use of the G2G Now app is mandatory in quarantine for these travellers.", "Extreme risk", "Travellers from Victoria need Western Australia government approval to enter the state, and are subject to the same restrictions as travellers from high-risk areas, but must quarantine at a government-approved hotel quarantine facility and also must get a COVID-19 PCR test on days 1, 5 and 12 of quarantine.\u00a0", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
